document.masterDocTitle: Kloosia Kruseman, Chernovskiia Saether, Robackia Saether, and Saetheria Jackson (Chironomidae: Chironominae) in Japan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Kloosia Kruseman, Chernovskiia Saether, Robackia Saether, and Saetheria Jackson (Chironomidae: Chironominae) in Japan

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined . JAPAN : Gifu Prefecture, Nagara River, 34 km from mouth,
1 male
,
28 .v. 2002
, S. Kasuya ( CHI 31 : 28 ); Gifu Prefecture, Nagara River, 10 km from mouth,
1 male
,
31 .v. 1999
, S. Kasuya ( CHI 36 : 58 ); Gifu Prefecture, Nagara River, 30 km from mouth,
1 male
,
22 .v. 1998
, S. Kasuya ( CHI 36 : 59 ); Gifu Prefecture, Nagara River, Nagara Ohashi,
1 male
,
3 .x. 2001
, T. Kobayashi ( CHI 36 : 60 ); Niigata Prefecture, Nagaoka City, Teradomari,
12 larvae
,
11 .ii. 2004
, I. Murakami ( CHI 36 :09- 20 ); Okinawa Prefecture, Ishigaki Island, Miyara River,
2 larvae
,
1–23 .xii. 2002
, N. Kitagawa (as
Beckidia
sp. BA = Chironomidae Genus CD- 1 and CD- 2 ; Kitagawa’s code: 9270 and 9100 , respectively).

Head (
Fig. 1
A). Frontal tubercle absent. Antenna with 11 flagellomeres; AR 1.21–1.33 [ 1.25–1.34 ].
Thorax. Acrostichals 2–3 [ 3–4 ]; dorsocentrals 5 –9, 7 [ 6 ]; prealars 2 –4, 3 [ 3 ]. Scutellum with 4–6 [ 4 ] setae.

Wing (
Fig. 1
B). Length 1.12–1.40 , 1.24 [ 1.10–1.20 ] mm; bare, with weak anal lobe. Squama bare.

Legs Fore tibial scale and mid- and hind tibial combs as in
Figures 1
C–E. Pulvilli present. Lengths and proportions of legs as in
Table 1
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Lengths (in μm) and proportions of legs of
Kloosia koreana Reiss, 1988
, male, from Japan.

FIGURE 1.
Kloosia koreana Reiss, 1988
, male. A, head. B, wing. C, tibial scale of foreleg. D, tibial combs of midleg. E, tibial combs of hind leg. F, hypopygium.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hypopygium (
Fig. 1
F). Anal tergite with 4–6 median setae at base of anal point, anal tergite band Yshaped. Superior and inferior volsella almost of equal length. Superior volsella bare, with narrow base and broader apex, bearing 2 medial to distomedial long setae. Inferior volsella narrow, almost straight, without long apical setae.

Head. Antenna (
Fig. 2
D) 6 segmented, basal segment as long as 2 nd and 3 rd segment combined, blade arising subapically on 2 nd segment, extending to base of 5 th segment. Pecten epipharyngis a triangular plate, with c. 10 spines. SI seta-like; SII moderately long and broad (
Fig. 2
B). Mandible (
Fig. 2
A) with pecten mandibularis and seta interna. Premandible (
Fig. 2
C) with 3 apical teeth, without brush. Mentum (
Fig. 2
E) with 6 pairs of lateral teeth; and small, rounded, ventromental plate with smooth anterior margin. Body. Segments subdivided; anterior parapods with large, long claws; anal setae short.

Remarks. According to
Reiss ( 1988 )
,
K. koreana
differs from the other species of the genus by features of the hypopygium, having superior and inferior volsella subequal in length, anal point clearly shorter than the volsellae, and superior volsella with two long median setae separated by a distance of 1 / 3 to 1 / 4 the length of the volsella. In the other
Kloosia
species, the inferior volsella is clearly longer than the superior volsella, the two long median setae are situated more closely together, and at least one of them is placed apically.

The males examined are consistent with the description of
K. koreana
given by
Reiss ( 1988 )
and also the larvae examined conform to the larval descriptions of
K. koreana
in
Epler ( 2001 )
and WBD (World Biodiversity Database.

Kitagawa ( 2003 )
recorded a larva from sandy substratum in Miyara River, Ishigaki Island, Okinawa, as
Beckidia
sp. BA. Subsequently,
Kitagawa ( 2005 )
replaced its name with Chironominae Genus CD- 1 and also recorded Chironominae Genus CD- 2 in the same report. Re-examination of these two specimens showed that they do not belong in
Beckidia Saether
, but in
Kloosia
. The evidences are as follows: [Characteristics of
Beckidia
according to
Pinder and Reiss ( 1983 )
in brackets]. 1 ) Seta interna present [absent]; 2 ) Ventromental plate coarsely striated semilunar/rounded, shorter than mentum, with smooth anterior margin [coarsely striated with crenated anterior margin]; 3 ) Antenna with 6 segments [ 7 segments]; 4 ) Premandible with 3 apical teeth and one basal tooth [ 5 apical teeth]; 5 ) Mentum with 6 lateral teeth [ 5 lateral teeth]; 6 ) Seta subdentalis short, reaching only to basal tooth [long, slender, reaching nearly to apical teeth].
